statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Jalen Poyser made four 3-pointers and finished with 16 points, Stephen Zimmerman Jr. had 15 points and 10 rebounds, and UNLV beat New Mexico Highlands 107-45 on Monday night.

video.headline: UNLV freshman levitates for the monster jam
video.caption: Scott Van Pelt deems UNLV F Derrick Jones Jr.'s powerful slam the Best Available Video of the night.

video.title: UNLV freshman levitates for the monster jam

article.headline: UNLV hits 13 3s in 107-45 victory over New Mexico Highlands

images.name: UNLV freshman levitates for the monster jam
images.caption: Scott Van Pelt deems UNLV F Derrick Jones Jr.'s powerful slam the Best Available Video of the night.

article.linkText: UNLV hits 13 3s in 107-45 victory over New Mexico Highlands
article.story: LAS VEGAS -- Jalen Poyser made four 3-pointers and finished with 16 points, Stephen Zimmerman Jr. had 15 points and 10 rebounds, and UNLV beat New Mexico Highlands 107-45 on Monday night. UNLV went on a 47-4 spurt over the final 10:32 of the first half to take a 60-14 halftime lead. The Runnin' Rebels' lead reached the winning margin of 62 with 8:32 left in the second half. Zimmerman was 7 of 9 from the field and Poyser was perfect from distance for UNLV (2-0). Derrick Jones Jr. added 14 points, and Ike Nwamu and Jerome Seagears had 12 apiece. UNLV made 54 percent of its shots, including 13 of 27 3-pointers. Jonathon Mines led New Mexico Highlands with 12 points and Kendrick Nichols added 10. The Cowboys shot just 28 percent and turned it over 27 times. UNLV scored 43 points off the turnovers.

videos.headline: UNLV freshman levitates for the monster jam
videos.description: Scott Van Pelt deems UNLV F Derrick Jones Jr.'s powerful slam the Best Available Video of the night.
